subject: Re: [junit] iterative testing
msgSnippet: There s room for generalization, but here s one strategy for dynamically creating TestCases.. As its written, you should be able to run it and see a green bar.
messageBody:
There's room for generalization, but here's one strategy for dynamically
creating TestCases..

As its written, you should be able to run it and see a green bar. If you're
interested in verifying that it really does verify the urls, add something
malformed or invalid to the list of URLs under test (urlsUT)

Best Regards,
Levi

===========================================
import java.net.MalformedURLException;
import java.net.URL;

import junit.framework.Test;
import junit.framework.TestCase;
import junit.framework.TestSuite;
import junit.swingui.TestRunner;

public class AllURLTests extends TestSuite {

private static final String[] urlsUT =
new String[] { "http://www.google.com", "http://junit.org" };

public static void main(String[] args) {
TestRunner.run(AllURLTests.class);
}

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite dynamicSuite = new TestSuite();
for (int i = 0; i < urlsUT.length; i++) {
appendTestFor(urlsUT[i], dynamicSuite);
}
return dynamicSuite;
}

private static void appendTestFor(String url, TestSuite suite) {
suite.addTest(new SingleURLTest("testURLSanity", url));
}

private static class SingleURLTest extends TestCase {
private String urlUT;

public SingleURLTest(String testName, String theUrlUT) {
urlUT = theUrlUT;
}

public String getName() {
return "SingleURLTest for: " + urlUT;
}

protected void runTest() throws MalformedURLException {
// successful construction == valid urlUT :)
new URL(urlUT);
}
}
}
===========================================
